meanings.definition: To digitally alter or enhance a photograph or image using software.
meanings.sent1: She teleshopped her selfie to make her skin look smoother.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers often teleshop images to make them more appealing.
meanings.sent3: The cat teleshopped its own picture to impress other cats online.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it seemed like she had teleshopped it.
meanings.sent5: The artist teleshopped the landscape to create a surreal masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of purchasing goods or services through a television shopping channel.
meanings.sent1: He made a teleshopped purchase for a new kitchen gadget.
meanings.sent2: Teleshopped items often come with special discounts on TV.
meanings.sent3: The teleshopped delivery arrived just in time for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with teleshopped treasures from the shopping channel.
meanings.sent5: The teleshopped products on TV always look so tempting.
